Package renderer

Class RayTracerBasic

java.lang.Object
renderer.RayTracerBase
renderer.RayTracerBasic
public class RayTracerBasic extends RayTracerBase
class RayTracerBasic used for finding the color for pixels

  • Method Details

    • traceRay

      public Color traceRay(Ray ray)
      Specified by:
      traceRay in class RayTracerBase
      Parameters:
      ray - ray from the camera through the viewplane
      Returns:
      the color of the closest point among the list of intersections

    • calcGlobalEffects

      public Color calcGlobalEffects(Ray ray, int level, Double3 kx, double kkx)
      inner function helper function for calcGlobalEffects used for recursion could have been written in reg calcGlobal but instead of writing it twice for reflect and refract
      Parameters:
      ray - from the point to the camera
      level - number of recursions left
      kx - constant coefficient of lowering (could be kt or kr)
      kkx - current kx, if it is smaller than min it won't add much to total color so no need to calc it
      Returns:
      color

    • calcGlobalEffects

      public Color calcGlobalEffects(Intersectable.GeoPoint geoPoint, Vector v, int level, double k)
      outer function function calcGlobalEffects handles reflections and refractions of light on a specific point
      Parameters:
      geoPoint - the point to calculate the color for
      v - the vector from the camera to the point
      level - how many recursion can still be performed
      k - constant coefficient of lowering
      Returns:
      the color for that point

    • calcColor

      public Color calcColor(Intersectable.GeoPoint closestPoint, Ray ray, int level, double k)
      inner function
      Parameters:
      closestPoint - the point that we want to find the color of
      ray - the ray from the camera through a pixel
      k - influence of current recursion
      level - number of recursion
      Returns:
      the color for that point recursive function

    • constructReflectedRay

      public Ray constructReflectedRay(Point p, Vector v, Vector n)
      Parameters:
      p - point at the head of the ray for the reflection
      v - the vector from the camera to the point
      n - the normal vector from the point
      Returns:
      the reflected ray

    • constructRefractedRay

      public Ray constructRefractedRay(Point p, Vector v, Vector n)
      Parameters:
      p - point at the head of the refracted ray
      v - the vector from the camera to the point
      n - the normal vector from the point
      Returns:
      the refracted ray

      Parameters:
      softShadowsButton - boolean enable soft shadows
      number_of_points - number of points for caluculating shadows
      Returns:
